answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hi Gordon,
The Knowledge Network has some case studies that should be useful for your research. 
A Manager’s Precarious Exercise with a Sports Complex - describes the process in which the city manager of the City of Hays in Kansas worked with residents for the construction of a city run sports complex while facing opposition from the city commission. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/102383/A_Managers_Precarious_Exercise_with_a_Sports_Complex 
2010 ICMA Community Partnership Award nominee: South Recreation Project – provides a case study of Central City in Nebraska where the city manger worked extensively with the community to understand its needs. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302384/2010_ICMA_Community_Partnership_Award_Nominee_South_Recreation_Project 
I hope that is helpful,
Pooja Varma
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

author: Gordon Siebert
text:
I'm interested in assembling case studies on successful strategies and campaigns for building public and Council support for Facilities projects and programs.  Please contact me and I'll do the interviewing and writing.   I am a former city manager and currentl local government employee as well as a city council member.
Gordon Siebert
title: Developing Public Support
